titleStmt.title: The life and death of william Long beard, the most famous and witty English traitor, borne in the citty of London Accompanied with manye other most pleasant and prettie histories, by T.L. of Lincolns Inne, gent.
titleStmt.author: Lodge, Thomas, 1558?-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Rychard Yardley and Peter Short, dwelling on Breadstreat hill, at the signe of the Starre,

notesStmt.note: Title is found in 2 states: with or without a Latin motto. This copy lacks the motto.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: Breadstreat hill, at the signe of the Starre
